thread.title: Baylor Quarterback Suffers Neck Injury in 45-27 Win vs. Iowa State
thread.title_full: Baylor Quarterback Suffers Neck Injury in 45-27 Win vs. Iowa State

author: Jessica Morrey
title: Baylor Quarterback Suffers Neck Injury in 45-27 Win vs. Iowa State
text:
Baylor Quarterback Suffers Neck Injury in 45-27 Win vs. Iowa Sta - kcentv.com - KCEN HD - Waco, Temple, and Killeen Baylor Quarterback Suffers Neck Injury in 45-27 Win vs. Iowa State Posted: jmorrey@kcentv.com 
WACO, TEXAS -- Baylor quarterback Seth Russell suffered a neck injury in the Bears 45-27 win over Iowa State on Saturday. 
Russell left the game in the fourth quarter. Postgame X-Rays and a CT scam revealed a fracture in one of the bones in his neck. 
Russell is set to visit a specialist next week. 
Freshman Jarrett Stidham will move into the starting quarterback position until Russell is healthy. Chris Johnson will move back over to the quarterback position and will play behind Stidham 
The No. 2 ranked Bears have a bye week this next week and then they'll face Kansas State in Manhattan, Kansas on Thursday, November 5.
